usefulItems: 12-hole muffin tray, wire rack, small bowl, wooden skewer, oven
title: Prosciutto and sun-dried tomato muffins

ingredients.content: 80 g Parmesan cheese, cut into pieces (3 cm)
80 g sun-dried tomatoes, cut into pieces
1 ½ tsp gluten free baking powder

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 200°C. Grease a 12-hole muffin tray and set aside.
Place Parmesan into mixing bowl and grate <b>10 sec/speed 9<b>. Transfer 2 tablespoons into a small bowl and set aside. Leave remaining Parmesan in mixing bowl.
Add buckwheat groats to mixing bowl and mill <b>1 min/speed 9<b>.

Add basil, tomatoes, cottage cheese, baking powder, water, eggs and salt and mix <b>20 sec/speed 4<b>. Line each muffin mould with 1 slice of prosciutto and divide mixture evenly between muffin moulds. Sprinkle with reserved Parmesan, then bake for 20-25 minutes (200°C) or until a wooden skewer inserted into the centre of the muffins comes out clean. Transfer onto a wire rack to cool slightly before serving.

hintsAndTricks: You can store these muffins in the refrigerator for up to 2 days.
These high protein muffins are a wonderful "on-the-go" breakfast or an energy-boosting afternoon snack.
